esmModelGrid.description: The ORCA1 grid is a 1-degree resolution grid that can be thought of as being comprised of two adjacent grid tiles, the construction of which is as follows. The first, or south, tile of the ORCA1 grid is a regular logically-rectangular grid covering the portion of the globe from latitude 78.393501282 S to latitude 19.605793 N. The grid lines possess a constant 1-degree spacing in the x/longitude direction and a variable spacing in the y/latitude direction (~ cos(lat)). The south tile origin is located at: (i=1,j=1) = (78.393501282 S, 107.5 W). The second, or north, tile extends north from the aforementioned bounding latitude and is represented by a complex bi-polar grid in which the grid cells are irregular quadri- laterals. The two poles occur at (50N, 73E) and (66N, 107W). The great circle arc connecting the two poles represents the locus of the fold in the grid tile: the boundary of the tile contacts itself along this fold. Although conceptually made up of two tiles, the ORCA1 grid is usually encoded as a single logically-rectangular grid with index-space dimensions i=360 and j=291. The boundary between the south and north tiles is at row j=182. Thus, for the south tile, the grid indices are (1:360, 1:182). For the north tile the grid indices are (1:360, 183:291). Scalar quantities (referred to as T variables) are calculated at grid cell centres, though the location of the centres cannot be derived exactly from the grid cell corner coordinates. Likewise, vector quantities are evaluated at the grid cell mid-points, which are not exactly half-way between the corners. A further complication arises from the fact that the grid cell boundaries are not straightforward curves, i.e. they are neither great circles nor straight lines in latitude-longitude space. For these reasons it is customary to specify the ORCA1 grid node positions using four separate grid encodings: one for the locations of scalar (T) quantities, and one each for the locations of the three vector quantities U, V and W. This is the encoding approach adopted in this grid specification. The ORCA1 grid is based upon a spherical figure of Earth with a radius of 6371229 m.

referenceList.reference: Madec and Imbard, 19xx. A global mesh to overcome the North Pole singularity. Climate Dynamics, vol 12, pp 381-388

gridTile.description: The T-grid defines the grid locations of scalar (T) quantities.
The U-grid defines the grid locations of U-component vector quantities.
The V-grid defines the grid locations of V-component vector quantities.

The W-grid defines the grid locations of W-component vector quantities. Note that W-grid locations share the same horizontal coordinates as T-grid locations but are one-half grid cell higher in the vertical direction.
The F-grid defines the grid locations of F-type quantities, such as the coriolis force. F-grid locations lie at the corners of the ORCA1 grid cells.
